logic.logicTransfer

Class Converter

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.logicTransfer.Converter

  • public class Converter
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that implements the Conversion from plain text to all game components

      • readStr

        public java.lang.String readStr(GUIConnector gui,
                                java.lang.String input)
        Reads string input and converts it into the appropriate game instance fields
        Parameters:
        gui - gui implementation to display a players action. Necessary in order to instanciate new Players since bots are required to hold a field containing a implementation of the gui interface in order to show their moves without cooperating with the main game class.
        input - input to convert
        Returns:
        String message containing the error messages, SUCCESSFUL_READ_MESSAGE if reading String was successful

      • genDescriptiveField

        public java.lang.String[][] genDescriptiveField(java.lang.String input)
                                         throws WrongTagException
        Takes a given String and extracts the information about the game. The data structure can be described as follows: <Spielfeld>\n text <Spielfeld>\n text <Spielfeld>\n text <Spielfeld>\n text <Baenke>\n text \\TODO find out what checkstyle means with parse error <Beutel>\n text

        Procedure: - Genereate a 2-dim String array containing a the tag for the information in the first field of a array entry and the actual data in the second. - Data is seperated from the corresponding identifier

        Parameters:
        input - String to extract data from
        Returns:
        String array containing the name of the field in the first slot and the actual data in the second
        Throws:
        WrongTagException - Exception that will be thrown if the tag syntax was not followed by the input String

      • genData

        protected java.lang.String genData(java.lang.String input)
                            throws WrongTagException
        Splits the data for the components from a given string. Checks if the correct syntax was followed
        Parameters:
        input - input from which the data for the components will be split apart from
        Returns:
        data component of the given string
        Throws:
        WrongTagException - Syntax containing an error message if syntax was not followed

      • fillFieldsWithDescriptiveBlocks

        public void fillFieldsWithDescriptiveBlocks(java.lang.String[][] descriptionBlocks,
                                            GUIConnector gui)
                                     throws WrongTagException,
                                            WrongBoardSyntaxException,
                                            WrongBankSyntaxException,
                                            WrongStackSyntaxException
        Generates the data for the fields. Iterates through the given description blocks, checks the title to chose which conversion method will be called
        Parameters:
        descriptionBlocks - multidimensional array containing a tag name in the respective first field and the data for the component fitting this tag in the second one.
        gui - gui reference needed for the player to be instanciated
        Throws:
        WrongTagException - Exception that will be thrown if the tag syntax was not matched by any given tag in the descriptive field array
        WrongBoardSyntaxException - Exception that will be thrown if the board syntax was not matched by any given tag in the descriptive field array
        WrongBankSyntaxException - Exception that will be thrown if the bank syntax was not matched by any given tag in the descriptive field array
        WrongStackSyntaxException - Exception that will be thrown if the stack syntax was not matched by any given tag in the descriptive field array
